name: Flowing clouds over the tops of the mountains
description: The further we got from sunrise, the more details and mountain peaks we could observe. Standing on the summit of Wołowiec, I was breathless at the sight of the morning spectacle, in which mists, clouds, first rays of the sun, temperature difference and beautiful High Tatras played a role. It was then that the trail I was going to follow that September day began to appear. That day turned out to be an amazing adventure. I walked from Polana Chochołowska to the peak of Wołowiec, from where I watched the sunrise. Then I walked along the chain of Western Tatra Mountains, up to Bystrá, which is on the Slovakian side, to return to Polana Chochołowska at the end. I walked about 30km that day and covered about 2500m up and the same amount down. It was a huge, yet incredibly rewarding effort. That day once again confirmed my conviction that trekking in the Tatra Mountains, although demanding, the pleasure of it makes up for all fatigue and difficulties.
